column4: In gnome-session-properties, I have only two options in  'session options' tab: save current session and  automatically  save changes to session. How can I see the list of sessions?
I logout, selected the gnome session, but nothing change. I mean, I cannot see the session list in gnome-session-properties.
there is no session list what are you talking about..? what ar eyou trying to do
I just have theses options in 'session options': http://img177.imageshack.us/my.php?image=screenshotsessionsga1.png
what do you expect to be there?
thats not what they mean, what do you want to create a new session for... what EXACTLY are you trying to do
are you trying to install a different Desktop Environment
your question made little sense but I think this is what you meant
try and research/read up a little before approaching IRC
you should get a good read on desktop managers.. see which you prefer.. I love gnome but many love kde
thats different distro and the session list in the gnome-sessions-manager is pointless.. install a DE of your choice then select it when logging in ?
